definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to complement one another (idiom)
whole/single entity
mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
essence/nature/innate character/intrinsic quality
interdependent
dualism/two sided/double nature
either this or that/one or the other
paradox (logic)
completely/sharply (differing)
the two poles/the north and south poles/both ends of sth/electric or magnetic poles
both/both of them/neither
to exist at the same time/to coexist
multiplicity
ultimately/in the final analysis/after all/when all is said and done
